conclusion: Calculate the electric field at point A due to charges 2q and -q using superposition principle.
Charge 2q is located at one vertex of the cube, charge -q at the opposite vertex, and point A at another vertex.
Distance from charge 2q to point A is sqrt(2)L, and from charge -q to point A is sqrt(3)L.
Electric field due to a point charge q at distance r is E = kq/r^2.
Electric field due to 2q at point A is kq/L^2.
Electric field due to -q at point A is -kq/3L^2.
Electric field due to 2q is directed away from 2q, and due to -q is directed towards -q.
Net electric field at point A is E_A = kq/L^2 - kq/3L^2 = 2kq/3L^2.
Magnitude of electric field strength at point A is 2kq/3L^2.
